register.name: SRSID
register.description: System Reset Status and ID Register

field.name: LVD
field.description: Low Voltage Detect: If PMC_SPMSC1[LVDRE] is set in Run mode or both PMC_SPMSC1[LVDRE] and PMC_SPMSC1[LVDSE] are set in Stop mode, and the supply drops below the LVD trip voltage, an LVD reset will occur. This field is also set by POR.\n NOTE: This field is reset to 1 on POR and LVR, and reset to 0 on other reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by LVD trip or POR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is caused by LVD trip or POR

field.name: LOC
field.description: Internal Clock Source Module Reset: Causes reset by an ICS module reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by the ICS module

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is caused by the ICS module

field.name: WDOG
field.description: Watchdog (WDOG): Causes reset by the WDOG timer timing out. This reset source may be blocked by WDOG_CS1[EN] = 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by WDOG timeout

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is caused by WDOG timeout

field.name: PIN
field.description: External Reset Pin: Causes reset by an active low-level on the external reset pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by external reset pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset came from external reset pin

field.name: POR
field.description: Power-On Reset: Causes reset by the power-on detection logic. When the internal supply voltage is ramping up, the low voltage reset (LVR) status field is also set at that time, to indicate that the reset has occurred while the internal supply was below the LVR threshold.\n NOTE: This bit POR to 1, LVR to uncertain value and reset to 0 at any other conditions

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by POR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: POR caused reset

field.name: LOCKUP
field.description: Core Lockup: Indicates a reset has been caused by the ARM core indication of a LOCKUP event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by core LOCKUP event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is caused by core LOCKUP event

field.name: SW
field.description: Software: Indicates a reset has been caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit in Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register in the ARM core

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

field.name: MDMAP
field.description: MDM-AP System Reset Request: Indicates a reset has been caused by the host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request field in the MDM-AP Control Register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

field.name: SACKERR
field.description: Stop Mode Acknowledge Error Reset: Indicates that after an attempt to enter Stop mode, a reset has been caused by the failure of one or more IICs to acknowledge within approximately one second to enter stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is not caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter Stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset is caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter Stop mode

field.name: NMIE
field.description: NMI Pin Enable: This field can only be written once after any reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PTB4/FTM2_CH4/SPI0_MISO/NMI/ACMP1_IN2 pin functions as PTB4, FTM2_CH4, SPI0_MISO, or ACMP1_IN2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PTB4/FTM2_CH4/SPI0_MISO/NMI/ACMP1_IN2 pin functions as NMI

field.name: RSTPE
field.description: RESET Pin Enable: This field can only be written once after any reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PTA5/IRQ/FTM0_CLK/RESET pin functions as PTA5, IRQ, or FTM0_CLK

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PTA5/IRQ/FTM0_CLK/RESET pin functions as RESET

field.name: SWDE
field.description: Single Wire Debug Port Pin Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PTA4/ACMP0_OUT/SWD_DIO as PTA4 or ACMP0_OUT function, PTC4/RTCO/FTM1_CH0/ACMP0_IN2/SWD_CLK as PTC4, RTCO, FTM1_CH0, or ACMP0_IN2 function

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PTA4/ACMP0_OUT/SWD_DIO as SWD_DIO function, PTC4/RTCO/FTM1CH0/ACMP0_IN2/SWD_CLK as SWD_CLK function

field.name: ADHWT
field.description: ADC Hardware Trigger Source: Selects the ADC hardware trigger source. All trigger sources start ADC conversion on rising-edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: RTC overflow as the ADC hardware trigger

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: PIT overflow as the ADC hardware trigger

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: FTM2 init trigger with 8-bit programmable delay

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: FTM2 match trigger with 8-bit programmable delay

field.name: RTCC
field.description: Real-Time Counter Capture: Allows the Real-time Counter (RTC) overflow to be captured by FTM1 channel 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: RTC overflow is not connected to FTM1 input channel 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: RTC overflow is connected to FTM1 input channel 1

field.name: ACIC
field.description: Analog Comparator to Input Capture Enable: Connects the output of ACMP0 to FTM1 input channel 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: ACMP0 output is not connected to FTM1 input channel 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: ACMP0 output is connected to FTM1 input channel 0

field.name: RXDCE
field.description: UART0_RX Capture Select: Enables the UART0_RX to be captured by FTM0 channel 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: UART0_RX input signal is connected to the UART0 module only

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: UART0_RX input signal is connected to the UART0 module and FTM0 channel 1

field.name: RXDFE
field.description: UART0_RX Filter Select: Enables the UART0_RX input to be filtered by ACMP. When this function is enabled, any signal tagged with ACMP inputs can be regarded UART0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: 0 UART0_RX input signal is connected to UART0 module directly

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: UART0_RX input signal is filtered by ACMP, then injected to UART0

field.name: FTMSYNC
field.description: FTM2 Synchronization Select: Generates a PWM synchronization trigger to the FTM2 module if 1 is written to this field

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No synchronization triggered

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Generates a PWM synchronization trigger to the FTM2 modules

field.name: TXDME
field.description: UART0_TX Modulation Select: Enables the UART0_TX output modulated by FTM0 channel 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: UART0_TX output is connected to pinout directly

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: UART0_TX output is modulated by FTM0 channel 0 before mapped to pinout

field.name: BUSREF
field.description: BUS Clock Output select: Enables bus clock output on PTH2 via an optional prescaler

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: Bus

enumeratedValue.description: Bus divided by 2

field.name: CLKOE
field.description: Bus Clock Output Enable: Enables bus clock output on PTH2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Bus clock output is disabled on PTH2

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Bus clock output is enabled on PTH2

field.name: DLYACT
field.description: FTM2 Trigger Delay Active: This read-only field specifies the status if the FTM2 initial or match delay is active. This field is set when an FTM2 trigger arrives and the delay counter is ticking. Otherwise, this field will be clear

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The delay is inactive

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The delay is active

field.name: DELAY
field.description: FTM2 Trigger Delay:Specifies the delay from FTM2 initial or match trigger to ADC hardware trigger when 1 is written to ADHWT. The 8-bit modulo value allows the delay from 0 to 255 upon the BUSREF clock settings. This is a one-shot counter that starts ticking when the trigger arrives and stops ticking when the counter value reaches the modulo value that is defined
